main

Class MainMenuDriveController

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.MainMenuDriveController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EditScheduleController, MainMenuRideController

    public class MainMenuDriveController
extends java.lang.Object
    Used as the controller for the MainMenuDrive.fxml scene. Allows user to schedule a day and time for transportation to destination. Allows user to navigate to the AccountSettings.fxml scene. Edited by Ryan McGuire 11/16/2018- added functionality of adding the users schedule to the database. Edited by Ryan McGuire 11/16/18 - added functionality to populate table from the drive tab with information from the SCHEDULEINFO table. Date: 11/2/2018

      • getRiderInfo

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<User> getRiderInfo()
                                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        When this method is called, the table SCHEDULEINFO will be searched. This search will return information from the LOCATION column if it is greater than or equal to the current date.
        Returns:
        scheduleInfo the list containing all information fetched from the USERINFO database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.

      • showTable

        public void showTable()
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        When this method is called, the table in the driver tab will populate with users who are looking to carpool.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.

      • getResultSet

        public void getResultSet(javafx.collections.ObservableList<User> scheduleInfo,
                         java.sql.ResultSet resultSet)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        When this method is called, it will create a new row in the table in the drive tab with information from the SCEDHULEINFO table.
        Parameters:
        scheduleInfo - list used to store information from the SCHEDULEINFO table search.
        resultSet - the result set used to populate the scheduleInfo list.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.

      • scheduleButtonPushed

        public void scheduleButtonPushed()
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 java.sql.SQLException
        When this button is pushed, the text fields, date fields, and time fields will be checked to see if they are blank. If they arte not blank, the information in the fields will be pushed to the SCHEDULEINFO table.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the IO exception.
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.

        Parameters:
        dateSelected - the date the user selects from the pickDate field.
        timeSelected - the time the user selects from the picTime field.

        public void pushToDatabase(User user)

      • getStartUp

        public void getStartUp()
        Method used for initial start up of scene. This will set the label to the username. This will disable users from picking a previous date on the date pick field. This will fill in the choices for both combo boxes.

      • displaySelection

        public void displaySelection(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.sql.SQLException
        When the user clicks twice on the table in the drive tab, it will create a new instant of the users.user type from the information in the table. This method will allow the driver to confirm to pick up a rider in the table in the drive tab.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - when clicked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the IO exception.
        java.sql.SQLException - the the SQL exception.
